metadata.title: CVE-2022-23467 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - low
metadata.description: OpenRazer is an open source driver and user-space daemon to control Razerdevice lighting and other features on GNU/Linux. Using a modified USBdevice an attacker can leak stack addresses of the`razer_attr_read_dpi_stages`, potentially bypassing KASLR. To exploit thisvulnerability an attacker would need to access to a users keyboard or mouseor would need to convince a user to use a modified device. The issue hasbeen patched in v3.5.1. Users are advised to upgrade and should be remindednot to plug in unknown USB devices.

criterions.comment: openrazer package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
